SE450: Algorithm Animation [35/36]


file:horstmann/ch09_animation1/ArrayComponent.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package horstmann.ch09_animation1;
00002: import java.awt.*;
00003: import java.awt.geom.*;
00004: import javax.swing.*;
00005: 
00006: /**
00007:    This component draws an array and marks two elements in the
00008:    array.
00009: */
00010: public class ArrayComponent extends JComponent
00011: {
00012:    public synchronized void paintComponent(Graphics g)
00013:    {
00014:       if (values == null) return;
00015:       Graphics2D g2 = (Graphics2D) g;
00016:       int width = getWidth() / values.length;
00017:       for (int i = 0; i < values.length; i++)
00018:       {
00019:          Double v =  values[i];
00020:          Rectangle2D bar = new Rectangle2D.Double(
00021:             width * i, 0, width, v);
00022:          if (v == marked1 || v == marked2)
00023:             g2.fill(bar);
00024:          else
00025:             g2.draw(bar);
00026:       }
00027:    }
00028: 
00029:    /**
00030:       Sets the values to be painted.
00031:       @param values the array of values to display
00032:       @param marked1 the first marked element
00033:       @param marked2 the second marked element
00034:    */
00035:    public synchronized void setValues(Double[] values,
00036:       Double marked1, Double marked2)
00037:    {
00038:       this.values = (Double[]) values.clone();
00039:       this.marked1 = marked1;
00040:       this.marked2 = marked2;
00041:       repaint();
00042:    }
00043: 
00044:    private Double[] values;
00045:    private Double marked1;
00046:    private Double marked2;
00047: }
00048:

file:horstmann/ch09_animation1/AnimationTester.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package horstmann.ch09_animation1;
00002: import java.awt.*;
00003: import javax.swing.*;
00004: 
00005: /**
00006:    This program animates a sort algorithm.
00007: */
00008: public class AnimationTester
00009: {
00010:    public static void main(String[] args)
00011:    {
00012:       JFrame frame = new JFrame();
00013:       frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
00014: 
00015:       ArrayComponent panel = new ArrayComponent();
00016:       frame.add(panel, BorderLayout.CENTER);
00017: 
00018:       frame.setSize(FRAME_WIDTH, FRAME_HEIGHT);
00019:       frame.setVisible(true);
00020: 
00021:       Double[] values = new Double[VALUES_LENGTH];
00022:       for (int i = 0; i < values.length; i++)
00023:          values[i] = Math.random() * panel.getHeight();
00024: 
00025:       Runnable r = new Sorter(values, panel);
00026:       Thread t = new Thread(r);
00027:       t.start();
00028:    }
00029: 
00030:    private static final int VALUES_LENGTH = 30;
00031:    private static final int FRAME_WIDTH = 300;
00032:    private static final int FRAME_HEIGHT = 300;
00033: }
00034:
